All Reviews

  1. I can honestly say that I have tried many curling irons and this by far is the best that I have used yet. There is nothing worse than a curling iron that doesn't generate enough heat to create a lasting hold. This curling iron has a maximum heat setting that will definitely lock in the style for a glam look. My hair looks absolutely stunning and it is full of bounce after I am finished working my magic with the Miraqueen. If you are looking for salon-styled hair at home, I would highly recommend this item as a &#34;must have&#34;. I also wanted to mention that in the past I have had lots of heat damage because of frequent heat-styling but, because of the ceramic design my hair actually feels much softer after curling and it is very shiny, so amazing. I must say that I do love the sleek design and color, it is totally stylish and modern looking. This also has a curl direction setting that lets you control which wan you want your curls to roll...what a genius idea! Having the option to change heat settings to 3 different levels with the use of a timer is also priceless, technology that is a must when considering quick styles on the run.<br />Another safety feature that I think is great and always look for is the automatic shutoff, this is great for quick sets. This is an amazing product with great functionality and ease of use. I am looking forward to purchasing a few for some of my besties for the holidays.
  2. I've been eyeing the Miraqueen for months now and held off on purchasing it because I was a little skeptical. I should've purchased this a while ago instead of a pricy curling wand for my hair extensions! To say that I love this product is a complete understatement. It takes me less than twenty minutes to curl my entire wig and the curls last long in my southern seventy degree humid weather. My favorite feature would have to be the LCD which shows the timer and temperature, which is important do I don't burn my hair weave. The handle is also small hand friendly. If you want to shave off time from your daily hair routine, buy the Miraqueen curling iron! What more can you ask for: less time, no burnt smell, hair extension friendly, comfortable for small hands, and affordable.

  4. I have naturally curly hair, so it holds curls very very well. It even has a feature to guarantee you dont have too much hair in the curler, so you get the perfect curl every time.<br /><br />If you're like me and hate using a curling wand because you burn your fingers five times every morning when you try to use it, the Miraqueen is great for you!<br /><br />While the price is a little higher than the wands you can find at Target and other stores, it's a great investment and will be the only curler you need!
  5. Curls have always been on my wish list. I say this because my hair is super long and super straight. Curling irons, curlers - none of them worked because my hair apparently LIKED being straight, and the sheer weight would make the tightest curl stretch out. So I gave up.<br /><br />Then my boyfriend bought me a Miraqueen iron (because it was pink!) and I couldn't just ignore his gift without using it at least once. Luckily, once was enough! This is so cool! I don't have to twist my hair around, losing strands and having it stick out at weird angles. Instead, I take a piece, it goes into a chamber and curls all by itself. One awesome feature of the Miraqueen is that I get to choose my temperature! For example, it's much harder to curl the hair in back, because of the weight. I use a higher temperature for that area, a lower temperature for my layers and bangs - you get the point.<br /><br />Another feature I don't know how I have lived without is the direction feature. So many times I've used curling irons or curlers and when I took them out, the hair curled in some random direction, never where I wanted it. This iron lets me change the direction of each curl - pretty cool - and the curls I get are tight curls. People don't realize how important that is!<br /><br />Hassle-free, Stress-free, GREAT results - I highly recommend the Miraqueen Professional Curling Iron is you want control over your hair!

  10. To preface I want to say that I have NEVER been able to figure out curling irons or wands. I've tried curlers, I've tried all the \\"no heat\\" methods I see online, and it just never works out well. So I was really excited to try a product that promised to give me perfect curls with zero skills or effort. And I am happy to report that this product does the trick!! Miraqueen curler is an odd looking device, especially if you're not entirely sure how it works, but once you read the instructions you get the hang of it really quickly. It will give you perfect curls every time. It has 3 heat settings (I use the 2nd setting) and 3 curl settings.. The device heats up SUPER quickly, which I love, because I am not very patient. I can report my hair did not tangle once, and after a few curls I was able to figure out how much hair was supposed to go in the barrel. Once your hair is in, the machine will beep, and once it is ready to release, it will beep faster. Again, the tighter the curl you want, the longer it will be in the chamber. The only time consuming part of the process is actually separating your hair into sections, so that your curled and uncurled hairs don't mix up. I am SUPER excited about this product and I know I will be using it a lot. I highly recommend it.

  48. Since growing out my hair, I have been searching high and low for something that will allow a curl to stay in my hair. I have long, medium thickness, layered, straight hair. Hot rollers, steam rollers, plain old ceramic irons.... I tried them all and nothing could create an all over consistant curl that would stay longer than 15 minutes. I heard great things about the conair curl secret- someone wrote a review that they didnt even need to use hairspray or hair product to get their curls to stay- but was hesitant to drop $100 on a curling iron, especialy when everything I had been trying wasnt working. Then I came across the Miraqueen Iron that is very simialar to the curl secret, but with a few pluses and $20 less. I decided to give it a try and am very happy that I did. The Miraqueen paired with a good hair product (I use Catwalk Curls Rock Amplifier) has been amazing!! I have been using it for over a week now and I have beautiful, look like they were just curled curls for 12+ hours. One time I used more product than I usually do, and I had awesome relaxed curl/waves the next day after I had slept on them...My husband even commented on how I had sexy bed head ;) I did try the iron without any product or hair spray and was not impressed. I think if I had shorter hair it probably could of happened, but with my length weighing on the curls, it was not meant to be.
  49. I have hair that can be categorized in the following keywords: Asian, Korean, long, thick, slighty wavy, on its way to being coarse, couldn't hold a curl to save my life. It took me 2 hours to curl one side of my head with my regular curling iron (of a good name brand) and the curls...they unraveled within an hour.<br /><br />I bought this in lieu of going to a salon that would have taken 3 hours out of my wedding day. It turned out to be unnecessary: I was in the pouring rain, wearing hair-covering veil, but I thought it looked pretty good for the reception even after being drenched.<br /><br />In short, never had curls that lasted more than an hour without the help of a perm.   59. The Miraqueen Professional Curling Iron is a must have product if you’re one of those girls who loves adding some playful curls to your daily hairstyle. From the ease of use to the curls that last up to four days, this product has focused specialization, curls, and definitely doesn’t disappoint in this arena!<br /><br />There are a few big differences about this curing iron that really made it stand out. The first is the technology that they included in both safety and most importantly, hair health. The Miraqueen Curling Iron contains tourmaline ceramic technology, which not only protects the hair but also helps the curls to last longer while locking in moisture.<br /><br />For those of you out there who, like me, aren’t exactly the most functional person in the morning, the safety features are a huge advantage of the Miraqueen Curing Iron. A foam layer on the top of the heading chamber helps to prevent any burns to the skin. In addition to the foam layer, there is a rubber protective layer raised from the heated surface so that the heated part of the iron never touches skin. The Miraqueen Curing Iron also has a plastic base so it doesn’t get hot to hold like some curling or flat irons out there.<br /><br />The easy to use LED display gives you any option you could possibly need in the most functional setup possible for perfect curls. You can set the temperature up to 450 degrees as one of three heat settings and four different timed settings to choose from depending on the look and style of the curl you want.<br /><br />The beeping timer helps you to make each curl exactly the same each time as well as protects against burning your hair if you happen to lose track of time. The easy release trigger makes the whole process extremely easy and the curls last up to four days; saving you time and giving you a “high maintenance” look for several days with little to no maintenance necessary with the Miraqueen Curling Iron.<br /><br />Another compelling featureI really enjoy is the 360-degree swivel cord, which helps to keep from becoming tangled while styling your hair. Throw in the one-year warranty, and I couldn’t recommend a better curling iron than the Miraqueen Nano Tourmaline Ceramic Curling Iron! The great ratings agree!

  104. I really wanted to like this, and I was so excited when it first came in. I read the reviews here carefully, and usually the reviews here don't let me down. I did notice that a lot of reviews did not have the \\"verified purchase\\" next to the review---and also, a lot of reviews have been done in a very short time---which did make me wonder for a bit about the validity. However, I purchased it anyway.<br /><br />I have fine, not colored, and very straight hair that is a little past my shoulders. Here are the reasons I do not care for this product:<br /><br />1. Time:<br />It will only take a very small section of hair at time, which means that this will take a long time. Longer than a curling iron and hot rollers. If you try to give it any more than the very small section, it will give the warning beeps that there is too much hair. Thankfully, it is easy to release hair (so my fear of hair getting tangled and stuck did not happen).<br />2. Lasting Power:<br />I tried this with the hairspray sprayed on first (like the video review) and without. Now my hair is difficult with holding a curl. It is pin straight naturally. However, the curls died off much quicker than what happens with my hot rollers.<br />3. Damage:<br />I put this on the lowest temperature setting, but it's still very hot. This is why it can curl in 8 seconds. When I used hairspray first, similar to the video review for this produce, I could hear a sizzling noise. I wouldn't think this would be helpful for hair. Even a good heat protectant won't be able to help that. When I lost the curl from this in a few hours, my hair seemed dry and damaged.<br /><br />Overall, I am not a fan and returning. Maybe it works on some hair types far better---as it seemed to for the video review. I really wish it did on mine! I'm going to stick to hot rollers. Hot rollers are not as fun as a device like this could be, but I find them very efficient as I can put makeup on while my hair is curling.
  105. First of all, I am bad with hair. I mean REALLY bad. All my life I've shied away from curling it because I end up burning myself, I fumble around with the curling iron for 20-30 minutes only to end up with a partially curled hair style that lasts a few hours. I've tried hundreds of how to videos and Pinterest instructional. As soon as I look in the mirror, my hands get all catawompus. I'm a mother of a toddler and I don't have much time or patience to fiddle with my hair so I basically have three daily hair styles I stick with. Down, ponytail, and half ponytail. Don't judge me! Then comes the MIRAqueen!!! So this is love! It's so easy a child could go it. I don't believe it's possible to burn yourself (short of intentionally sticking your finger down inside the heating chamber), it takes me between 5-10 minutes, and my curls last ALL DAY!<br />I've gotten three, maybe four other people to buy one. The number one question they have when I show them how it works is, &#34;will it eat my hair?&#34;. The answer is, no. It recognizes when you add too much and will beep to notify you and then uncoil. If you watch videos on YouTube you can not only see how it works but see how it reacts when jammed.
  106. This was a gift and the person it was purchased for just loves it - easy to use even on very thick, long hair.
  107. I REALLY Love this! I was skeptical because of the price...but i bought it and love it. Makes my hair look AMAZING for 2 days, easy to use, and compared to other similar curlers this was actually a great price. I recommend it a lot to friends.

  112. I can't believe how easy this is to use & how incredible the results are! I have medium to thick hair & it's a few inches past my shoulders, so it takes some SERIOUS time for me to curl if I put myself up to it, which isn't too often. It looks awesome when it is curled, but it doesn't seem to hold too long in my hair when I do it & I've had my hairdresser show me multiple times, lol.<br /><br />I decided to buy this after watching a few Youtube videos & reading some of the reviews on Amazon. I got it a week ago & I've used it once & it took me roughly 30-35 minutes to curl my entire head the first time using it. That incudes blow drying my hair as well, which takes me @ least 10 minutes. If you watch a video on Youtube, you don't even need to read the instructions, but basically you have to know to adjust the heat according to your hair type. I used a medium heat setting & I selected 10 seconds for the curl time (8 lowest/12 highest). Also you can select left, right, or alternate, which is the direction your curls will fall. I will personally always keep it on the alternate setting because I think the curls look better & make your hair look fuller that way. Also, you CANNOT burn yourself, which I'm famous for with curling irons. :( The device beeps @ you if you try putting too much hair in it, so don't panic if that happens & just release the lever & try again.<br /><br />Bottom line, this product is amazing & exceeded my expectations. My hair held the curls for 3 days, which sounds gross, but it's actually awesome because I don't like washing my hair everyday because it keeps it healthier with just 3-4 washes per week. Totally worth the money & I would highliy recommend!! *PS: My profile picture is what my hair looked like after using this fabulous product. :)

I really like that it has different settings so you can customize the intensity of the curls.<br /><br />It is a little heavy but you get used to the weight after awhile. There is definitely a learning curve to this product. I did get my hair tangled a couple of times trying to curl either too much hair or if I didn't brush it out enough. I think if you follow the instructions, you should get perfect curls every time! It does get easier the more you do it.<br /><br />I have gotten so many compliments on my hair! This was a great purchase!<br /><br />It has the option to have your curls go left, right, or automatic which alternates between the 2. It's super helpful when curling your hair but I feel bad for my husband early mornings when I'm getting ready and all he can hear is my beeping :) (this is a very minor issue but thought it was worth noting!)<br /><br />Overall, I'm extremely happy with this product it is really great.

With the Miraqueen I get beautiful, bouncy, and shiny curls that last. For an every day curl I use the 10 second time on the lowest heat and use no product. The result is soft and classy without looking overdone. If I want an amped up night look I just have to up the time and heat and add a little hairspray. On the second day I can just brush out my hair and I have those soft pretty day curls! There is absolutely nothing difficult about using this machine. Just follow the directions and be patient at first while you learn how much hair you need to put in and how smooth it should be. Once you get used to it (it doesn't take that long) you can fly through the process and it'll look better each and every time you do it. I'm so pleased with my purchase! I recommend it to all of my friends and use my Miraqueen to do their hair as often as I get so they can see how amazing it is for themselves. What helps me is to put in some Crew Fiber (men's product) in when my hair is wet. Just a SMALL amount. Dry naturally or with a hair dryer. The curl holds better and lasts to some degree all day long. Sometimes I'll re-curl a few spots if I need to look better in the evening.<br /><br />If you want a tight, classier, more controlled curl, do use a curling iron. It’s the ONLY product that has ever gotten my hair truly curly, and it stayed that way for hours! I’ve never burnt myself or damaged my hair, and I’ve learned to style my hair 3 or 4 different ways with just this one curling iron. I really like doing the wavy curls, but I’ve done some tighter spirals too as part of up-dos and this iron works really well. It’s amazing how the iron does all the work automatically, and I actually will curl my hair now for day to day stuff too because it’s just so easy to use. It curls up my entire head of hair fast, I can use it one-handed, and I can always just look on the LED screen to see if it’s the right temperature, so there’s no guess work. I guess maybe that’s not a problem for girls that have been curling their hair all their lives, but for me, it’s nice to have it be such an easy process.<br /><br />Also, I just want to mention that I like the rubberized protectors and heat insulators. I’m THAT person that thinks they left the curling iron on 5 minutes after I leave the house, and then I have to go back and check (and then, of course, I’m late for work). So knowing that it won’t burn down my house because it turns off automatically and has protections in place even if it stayed on-- I really like that they thought about that stuff when making this product.<br /><br />Great product. Definitely recommend the MiraQueen.

  219. The Miraqueen Professional Curling Iron does not look like any curling iron you have seen before because it is NOT like any curling iron you have seen before. With this smart design Miraqueen has applied smart, effective (and beautiful!) technology to curling irons that has long been missing in the world of hair care.<br />To break it down here is what I think sets the Miraqueen Professional Curling Iron apart from others:<br />-High temperature settings, but hair is still PROTECTED. This curling device heats up to an impressive 450 degrees F, but because of ceramic technology your hair is still protected. The combination of healthy hair and high temp curls means that curls will last and last.<br />-LED display takes away the guess work. If you are like me, you like to know what you are doing. Simply turning a wheel up or down like on a standard curling iron is relatively meaningless. With this easy to read display I know time and temperature with just a glance.<br />-Timer settings for curls. How much easier can it get than simply selecting a time setting to determine how tight or loose curls are. Genius!<br />This well-designed curling iron can take the place of those old fashioned curling irons and newer curling wands that constantly lead to burnt fingers. With all the good though, I will also mention two small tips to help others get started.<br />-There is a small learning curve. Try this out when you have some time to play with it as opposed to when you are rushing out the door. Soon it will SAVE you time, but for the first use or two, give yourself a few extra minutes.<br />-Detangle first. Like with any hair device, your results will look much better if you get any tangles out first.<br />Happy curling!

It used to be that you would have to wrap your hair around the rod of a curling iron to get it to curl, but with the Miraqueen your hair is pulled through the chamber and comes out curly/wavy. It is almost like magic - you have to see it to believe it. Not having to wrap your hair around the rod also pretty much eliminates the chance of burning yourself, so if you were prone to burning yourself on curling irons before and have the blisters to prove it, do yourself a favor and buy this.<br />The timer function is very helpful, too. The iron beeps when your hair is curled or waved to your specific desire (loose, medium, or tight), so hair is never in for a dangerously long amount of time (good for people like me, who sometimes get distracted whilst putting hot things on their hair).<br />With so many great features and at such a great price (seriously, the super cheap irons have NOTHING on this), I would recommend this to anyone in search of a hair-friendly, burn-free, SIMPLE curling iron!

My only tips of advice are 1) make sure you brush out any tangles. Seriously, do it. Before you send any hair through just take a brush or comb through the section and make sure that you are tangle free. 2) Don't try to do too much at once. The larger the section of hair you do the looser your waves will be, and in turn the smaller the section is the tighter and more ringlet like the curl will be.

  289. Because of a mild disability, I find it nearly impossible (and quite dangerous/time consuming) to curl my own hair with a conventional curling iron. I tried a curling wand with mediocre results. When I finally found this product, I was thrilled but skeptical. Then, my sister gave me one for my birthday. I was nervous the first time I used it. I imagined my hair becoming impossibly tangled inside the curling chamber and burning off. However, let me assure you that nothing of the sort has happened yet. I love this product! It's incredibly easy and safe to use (in comparison to conventional curling irons). This morning, for the first time in my life, I was able to curl my hair (and not just the front of my hair) without assistance. This product really works!<br /><br />Nonetheless, I have a few important notes about this product:<br /><br />1) It is possible to get your hair tangled in the curling chamber. This happened while I was curling my mom's hair. However, this mostly happens if you either try to stuff too much hair into the curler at once or if you fail to adequately detangle/separate the hair before curling it. If you avoid those mistakes, your hair should not become tangled in the curling chamber. If your hair DOES become tangled, the curler will instantly stop spinning and beep three times. When that happens, immediately open the curler, slowly work your hair out, fix the problem, and try again. This approach worked painlessly when my mom's hair became tangled.<br /><br />2) It is also possible to be burned. However, I have only been burned after keeping the curler on high for an extended period of time (while my sister, mom, and I were taking turns using it), which gave the protective lining time to heat up. However, the &#34;burn&#34; was more of a discomfort and nowhere near as painful as a conventional curling iron burn. (Think of the sensation when someone is curling your hair with hotsticks and lets them touch your skin.) When the outside of the curler becomes hot enough to cause discomfort, simply allow the curler to cool down a bit or simply don't allow it to directly contact your head during curling (not too difficult).<br /><br />Nonetheless, if you're like me and LOVE your hair curled but become very nervous when someone gets too close to your head with a conventional branding--er, curling--iron, you'll adore this product. I feel very safe while using it. I'm definitely giving this product five stars. While I haven't tried the steam version yet, this is the best curling product I've used so far.outside of the curler becomes hot enough to cause discomfort, simply allow the curler to cool down a bit or simply don't allow it to directly contact your head during curling (not too difficult).<br /><br />Nonetheless, if you're like me and LOVE your hair curled but become very nervous when someone gets too close to your head with a conventional branding--er, curling--iron, you'll adore this product. Very easy to use, and ideal when you're feeling a little bit sleepy in the morning and not paying attention!<br /><br />Another useful feature is the swivel socket so your cord doesn't get tangled up as you move around your head creating curls. All in all a really great product that I'd recommend to anyone who wants a head full of curls with the least amount of pain and effort.

FYI - I use Wen for cleaning my hair - don't really think that makes a difference overall, but it does hold the color in my hair.<br /><br />I used the lowest heat setting and the 8 second setting, and I had to work at it a bit to pull some of the curl out of my hair when I got it all done. I got my hair stuck in the machine twice, but that was because I tried to put too wide of a hair section into the chamber. It didn't harm the hair or anything - just had to start those sections over again. The first time I used it, it probably took me 30 minutes to do my hair, but that was because of the learning curve. As you work with the device and get the hang of it, it takes much less time.<br /><br />Highly recommend this product! Depending on your hair type and thickness, you won't need anything else but a hair dryer and perhaps a flat iron to smooth your hair down first if it's really thick or coarse.   407. LOVE LOVE LOVE this curling iron!!! Got it for myself for Christmas and am not disappointed! There is a bit of a learning curve, but I am so glad to have this item in my bag of tricks! Will experiment more with the different directions of curls at some point. Used automatic today. Didn't make my hair smell burnt, which is something I can't stand about regular curling irons!! Gets nice and hot and makes beautiful curls that are bouncy and soft. Use very small strands of hair to keep it from rejecting. My hair got stuck a couple times, but nothing a couple clicks of the wand couldn't fix! Looking forward to using this a lot more!! Highly recommend!!
  408. I have long, wavy, somewhat thin hair which was fully dried, product-free, brushed out, and tangle-free when I tested out the Miraqueen Professional Curling Iron. My hair consistently got tangled in the curling chamber. I turned off the device each time to keep my hair from getting damaged by the heat and it took several minutes for each attempt to release my hair from the chamber. If my hair ever got stuck to the point that I couldn't remove it (which didn't happen), I was fully prepared to break the device before ever considering chopping off a section of hair. So- why keep trying to curl my hair if it kept getting stuck? I wanted to make sure it wasn't user error. (Plus- I wanted to make sure I'd have a thoroughly written product review.) I tried smaller sections of hair, larger sections of hair, and in-between. I tried both the 370* and 410* temperate settings. I also tried straitening my hair, and then curling it again, which didn't help either. Sometimes, the device only partly took my hair and didn't suck the ends into the chamber. There were multiple times when, after sucking up the middle and end sections of hair, the device sucked itself against my scalp. It didn't burn, but it certainly hurt because it was trying to pull my hair out of my head. During the few times that the device actually seemed to work, (when it sucked up the whole section of hair without sucking itself to my scalp and it properly released the curl) the curls came out terrible. I feel like this was due to the fact that, after sucking up the end section of hair, it kept trying to suck up more and more hair that wasn't there, which could have tightly curled some of the hair in the chamber. What I'm trying to say is that- the area that I clamped the device down on, came out crimped. The section of hair right below that came out tightly curled (curls the size of your thumb). I was using the 8 second time setting which should have resulted in a loose curl. The end section of hair was the only part that came out looking perfect. Again, I'll point out- there were Very Few times that the chamber actually released my hair. This curling iron hurt my head, possibly damaged my hair a bit, pulled out many strands of hair, could have left me with the decision to either break the device or cut my hair, and the resulting curls were disastrous looking. It was a huge pain in the butt and I will be returning it. I'm sure it's a great curling iron for most chicks, however, I think long, thin haired women should avoid this product.
  409. This is the best curler! I always wanted to be those girls who has beautiful curls (I have straight to wavy hair) and i bought at least 7different types of curlers (remington, bed head, hot tools) from the typical round to ones with the wavy plates. I believed they would be simple, fast and give me the look i wanted. They did work, but I hated how it would take sooo long (it would take me 30min-1h). For someone who mostly puts her hair into a bun or ponytail, that's pure torture!<br /> But after using this Miraqueen, I'll probably curl it more. It only took 20min (with a bit of goofing around) to complete it!! My hair is normal to thick, and reaches my lower back. There are 3different settings that I like which most other automatic curlers don't (usually just has 2). This one has settings for the seconds it holds ur hair, the temperature AND the rotation of the curl (right/left/alternating) (many of others I found don't have this feature which is great for unexperienced people like me).<br />Also, its pink! More like a purple/pink but my favorite colors so love it!<br />It won't pull out ur hair even if u put too much ( it can only take about an inch of hair, but also seems to depend on the length of ur hair). It will automatically try to release ur hair if it gets stuck and will beep when its stuck (~2beeps) and when its done (1beep).

  455. This thing is awesome! There is a learning curve to it, but once you get the hang of using it you will never use another curling iron again. I have long straight hair, and this thing works great! There are many advantages of using the Miraqueen compared to regular curling irons: it is cool to not have to worry about a hot barrel burning your fingers, forehead, neck, or ears. With the Miraqueen you don't have to twist or wind your hair and the ends of your hair don't fall out of the barrel. I can’t express how many times I’d wind my hair around a normal curling iron just to have the ends of my hair fall out before finishing and having to re-curl and re-curl and re-curl. That frustration is now a thing of the past since I have found this thing. I found that using it on thinner strands gives you the best results for tighter curl and bigger sections is best for a more uniform wave. Also, if you leave it on for the 12 seconds it is better than doing 10, for me anyways. I would recommend watching some YouTube videos before trying to use this. As I mentioned, there is a bit of a learning curve to using this, and the videos really help you get a good idea of what you should do. Once you get it down though, you will be able to do your whole head is five to ten minutes unlike spending 45 minutes with a regular curling iron. The biggest challenge is doing the back of your hair. I recommend either using multiple mirrors or getting a friend to help you out. When you consider the price and the time the Miraqueen saves you, it is definitely a great purchase to make.

  482. I had been eyeing the MiraCurl for a few years now but couldn't justify the price. My husband ended up getting me this for Christmas and I'm so glad he did. I love it!!! I have been using it every other day since then and feel I have enough experience with it now to finally post my review (although I wanted to gush about it right away!) I have very fine, unprocessed, medium length hair (about 2-3 inches past my shoulders) that has never held a curl a day in my life until now. Because of my fine hair, I have only ever used this on the lowest heat and curl time setting (370 degrees/8 seconds) so my review is for that heat and time setting only. The machine itself takes about 1 minute from the time you turn it on until it's ready to use at this setting. You will know it's ready when it stops blinking and you hear three rapid beeps. You can curl your hair to the left, right or auto (which alternates between the two). I find it works best when you put 1-1.5 inches of hair in the curler at a time. Any more than that seems to get caught, which has happened to me, but infrequently. When it does, it's always my fault from putting too much hair in at once and the machine promptly stops. My hair has never gotten tangled or stuck; it slides out easily. Even at the lowest setting, I cannot believe how curly this makes my hair. You can get the barrel quite close to your head too so it curls from root to tip. I've used it on both freshly washed and unwashed hair and it works beautifully either way. This seriously leaves my entire head with full, voluminous, bouncy curls!! I prefer softer waves so I just run my fingers through it a few times after I'm done and I'm good to go. Since I wash my hair every other day, I can say that the curls last until my next wash so, for 48 hours. No, they're not as tight as when I first use it, but that's also because I run my fingers through them to soften them up. The machine is so easy to use too and on average, I have timed the entire process at 14 minutes to do my whole head. You can't beat it!! I love this machine and can't say enough good things about it. It's awesome and truly works. ***** UPDATE (2/1/16) ***** It has been well over a year since I first started using this and it still works great!! I still love it and it has held up under near constant use (just about every other day). I even dropped the thing once from my bathroom vanity and it's still working great. I will say that every now and then I do have to re-curl a strand of hair that did not curl the first time, but it's not a big deal. It's probably because of build up on the barrel which I guess is expected over time. I see that Amazon has not been selling this anymore for a while so I'm hoping the one I have will last forever. I can't live without it!!! :)

I have tried cooler irons and they just won’t curl my hair. I also love the fact that it has multiple curl directions and timer settings. The timer settings determine the tightness of the curl: loose, medium and tight. So you can create a range of looks. And, there is absolutely no guesswork. You adjust the setting on the handle to the type of curl you want and it will tell you exactly when to remove it with a series of beeps.<br /><br />It is made of ceramic, which is a huge benefit for me. I won’t even consider buying a product that is not anymore – my hair is just too easily damaged. I also like the safety features because I don’t know how many times I have burned my head or hand on a regular curling iron. Not possible with the Miraqueen. And if you are like me; forgetful, it comes with an Auto-off feature so you don’t burn the house down.<br /><br />It is a little scary, the first time it sucks your hair in. But there was no pulling or tugging at all. Overall, it is a very good little investment in time-savings and money.

  507. I have to admit, I don't review products as often as I should considering that I depend on reviews a lot when determining whether or not to purchase items online. This product exceeded my expectations so much that I just have to let anyone know how wonderful it is if they are hesitant to spend the money. (and I am an actual customer) I am a mother of two, one of which is a toddler, and fixing my hair is not a top priority though I've always sought out ways to curly my hair which is so popular now and I haven't found anything that works like this. I, like so many others, have bought wands and straightners and watched countless videos on how to use them to achieve pretty curly hair with no luck. I might get lucky and end up with one curl that looks good and the next one looks all weird and bendy? I also must admit that if it involves much more skill than putting my hair in a pony tail (which is my look 99% of the time) I'm all thumbs. Somehow when I look in the mirror, I turn into a clumsy idiot. This curling device has changed all that. Finally, my hair looks like I want it to look and it's EASY! My hair is pretty long and I can curl it with this in 15 minutes. I have gotten so many compliments. The instructions included in the box are not very good, basically how to turn the thing on so I suggest you watch some videos on this device or a similar one for some tips but there isn't much of a learning curve, it just works! A big question people ask is whether or not it tangles your hair up in it and I can honestly say it has not happened to me yet. If you are like me and think this thing seems a bit pricey and hesitant on whether or not it will work, don't be, you won't be disappointed. I hope it last a long time and in the long run won't seem like much especially if I add up all the cheaper devices I've purchase that don't work at all for me. I love it so much, I'm almost considering buying a &#34;spare&#34; just in case this one quits and they discontinue it or something. One tip, I can give for any other &#34;hair challenged&#34; people like me that I found on a video at some point that I found helpful is to section your hair and curl the top first, which is backwards of most tuturiols you see. I curl the top first while the bottom section is tied out of the way with a hair tie then gently clip the curled top section and curl the bottom. When doing it the traditional way, I always felt that the top section just got intermingled with the bottom while trying to finish the top. One more thing, I was a bit hesitant on this one just because it was cheaper than the perhaps the more well known brands but it seems sturdy and not cheaply made at all. I'm very happy that I decided on this one. Oh, and one more thing, in my research, I did see where possibly some of the other brands don't have the &#34;alternating&#34; option for the curl direction or maybe only curled in one direction. I always use the alternating option because it gives me the look I'm going for.
  508. I am very impressed with this product. This is the only curling iron that I have used that my hair will actually keep the curl. Easy to use and so glad to have it.
  509. I am not one of those women who is &#34;good&#34; at doing hair. Most of my life I've been blessed with &#34;wash and go&#34; hair and haven't messed with it - still can't master a round brush and blow dryer except for on my bangs, and I wasn't introduced to a flat iron until college when I decided to go short for the first time in my life....in Florida...talk about 3 mile wide hair. Just setting expectations for what kind of hair skill person I am. Also I guess I should note my hair type for comparison - I have very thick, red hair - i.e. prone to frizz - and a lot of it, which is currently bra clasp length. Although it is thick, it does have some natural wave/curl and holds curl fairly well.<br /><br />I wanted to get those big-almost-waves-but-still-curls thing but wasn't sure I had the skills for a traditional curling iron and was just plain terrified of the clipless/wand things (sorority sister got a really nasty burn on that thing in college and I still have nightmares about it). Read some reviews - decided to go with the Miraqueen Professional Curling Iron - it was less expensive than the Conair Pro and had more features - mainly the curl direction choice.<br /><br />I've used it twice so far and it's amazing! I didn't really time myself to the exact minute - but I would say it took 35-40 minutes the first time (mostly because of trial and error) and less than 30 min the second time - definitely comparable to a flat iron timing for me. I've gotten so many compliments on my hair! The first time it was a bit tighter than I was going for, but still pretty. I was able to get the look I was going for by doing it the night before with no hairspray, medium heat/timing, and combing out in the morning to soften. In the two times I've used it I have NEVER gotten my hair stuck/tangled in it. Follow the instructions and brush out right before you feed it in with a fine tooth brush, and respect the 1/2-1 inch rule. The few times I got overzealous with section sizing the device immediately figured out it was too much hair and stopped. The curls stay for days without hairspray. I did not use a protector - but my hair doesn't feel &#34;fried&#34;. It does get a little heavy if you have a lot of hair...but no worse than those 2&#34; ceramic flat irons used to be or a hairdryer. It did not get hot enough to burn my hand or head - though I still might not put it completely up to my scalp on the high setting. Despite being so lazy about beauty regimes, I can definitely see myself using this regularly. I'm going to be a bridesmaid this fall and will DEFINITELY be bringing this with me to DIY my hair - side pony/braid and use the &#34;ringlet&#34; feature of this thing on the ends and it'll look like I spent $100.<br /><br />Tips for long hair:<br />1. I did find that I needed to use the medium heat and longer time setting for the bottom section and shorter time setting for the top section/layers to keep it non-poodle-esque. If you are good with hair you probably already knew this - I did not. The bottom section fell out after about a day, the top section stayed curly for 3 sleeps after the initial curl - with NO hairspray - probably would have stayed longer but I washed my hair.<br />2. If you are going for the more long loose curls look, start halfway down your hair instead of near the scalp. I have more than enough volume and decent natural wave, I just wanted something more controlled looking. When you start halfway down the hair you can also get away with a larger section than by the scalp because it's already smoothed into a single &#34;tube&#34; instead of the &#34;cone&#34; of hair at the root when you gather it. If that makes sense... Also curl the night before and sleep on it, then comb out in the morning and go.<br />3. Use the auto rotate feature except for the 1-2 curls directly by your face which you curl outward.<br />4. If you want thicker bigger curls - use the same direction for a few sequential curls and you can then grab all of them at the root together and carefully run your thumb and forefinger along them to combine into one big fat curl<br />5. Watch some youtube videos (even if they are for the conair pro or babybliss) for more tips or tricksd you can then grab all of them at the root together and carefully run your thumb and forefinger along them to combine into one big fat curl<br />5. Watch some youtube videos (even if they are for the conair pro or babybliss) for more tips or tricks
  510. Works perfectly no issue with tangling if used following the instructions.
  511. I love this product and I get lots of compliments when I use it
  512. Don't bother wasting your money. I anticipated the arrival of this curling iron but after using it was extremely disappointed. I used very thin strands and even with that and the highest, longest heat setting, the best I got was big waves. My hair is fine and I have a lot of it. I get much better curls with my conair regular iron. It also mentions tanglefree...umm no, my hair tangled 4x and it was not pleasant getting it out, and yes, I did comb the strand before placing it in the iron. Disappointment abounds with this product. Sending it back immediately.
  513. I received the Miraqueen Professional Curling Iron as a gift and I was so skeptical when I first went to use, not to mention terrified that it would destroy my hair! After letting it heat up completely I decided to be brave and try it on my hair and the results were absolutely stunning! My hair was so curled with gorgeous ringlets and the device was super east to use. The curl stuck in my hair overnight and into the next day with no fall-out or loosening of the curls, and I received A TON of compliments. I was so excited to finally have a product that worked so well, especially since curling you hair can take so long and this just took minutes! Unfortunately, I was only able to use this device TWICE before the heating unit went out and stopped curling my hair.<br /><br />When I say the heating unit went out, that's just my guess. I'm not an expert and I could be wrong but the device just stopped getting hot. It would get warm but not nearly as hot as it needed to be. The ringlets soon become just waves and it was no longer giving me the results it once did. I waited to make sure it was &#34;completely&#34; warmed up, it beeped to indicate that it was. I held it in my hair for the duration selected and waited until it beeped after 12 seconds as well. I tried switching the direction of the curl, I tried making it hotter, I tried leaving it in my hair longer, NOTHING WORKED. I even made sure I had it plugged in to a power source that had the required amount of voltage needed.<br /><br />I'm so upset that it stopped working after TWO uses because it was fantastic when it was actually getting up to temp :(
  514. Great hair curler, but I had to wait 5 months for it to be back in stock prime and the regular price ($89.99) since Christmas 2014. The curler itself works well. It beeps at you if you put in too much hair (for me about 1 inch width is the max). I have long straight thick hair and it curls it well, though some curls have to be redone by the time I am done. It takes approximately 35-40 minutes to curl all my hair, pinning it up and curling it by layers. I use Shea Moisture shampoo and conditioner and the oils in these do not cause my hair to burn. It is virtually impossible to burn yourself with it unlike regular hair wand curlers, and this doesn't entail wrapping or twisting. My hair got stuck a few times but it was easy to ease it out and did not get split or cut up. I use organic sweet almond oil as frizz control and heat protectant with this curler, and I have heard that avocado oil works well as heat protectant with it too. I haven't needed a hair spray to hold the curls, though I recommend Herbal Essence flexible hold hair spray because of its ingredients.

I cannot say enough great things about this. I will never use a curling iron again. Best $60 I have spent in a long time!

Always have the roller part facing your head and it will never turn out bad. The only thing that wasn't really true for me was that I would be able to curl my whole head in 5 minutes. My hair is shoulder length, pretty straight, not course at all, but it's still really thick, so I knew it would take me longer. The first time I used it, it was probably closer to 25 minutes, and a lot of that was probably just because it was the first time.<br /><br />I did also buy the Babyliss Pro Miracurl Hair Product Kit to go with it. I prepped the hair with the curl prep spray, dried thoroughly, and just grabbed about a 1 inch section of hair, set the curler to 450 and used the setting for 10 seconds and got a perfect curl! At one point, I did start to get a little impatient and tried to use a section of hair that was too big, so it got a little caught. It triple beeps to let you know it's stuck, and stops trying to pull the hair in. I pulled the plug to make sure the heat was off and just tugged a little section of hair out at a time and had it free in about 5 seconds. My hair was not tangled, knotted or damaged so that was good! So that's my only note, just make sure you are not using sections of hair that are too big, and brush out the section before you feed it in, or it might get caught. Even when it starts to get caught, I started to get a feel for it, and was able to pull the hair out before it started to really catch and then just re-feed it in.<br /><br />The curls held all day, and even though I am not used to being able to curl my own hair, it was actually pretty easy to style. I letthe curls relax just a little and ran my fingers through it. Then I sprayed with thermal shine spray and defining spray and I couldn't believe how good it looked! I have always been good with makeup, and did my own for my wedding, but hair has never been my strong area. If I had owned this curler then, I would have done my hair myself too! That's how happy I am with the results!<br /><br />If you're like me and have struggled finding curlers that work the way they advertise and actually work son hair that is at time resistant to curling, this is worth trying.   561. I normally don't bother curling my hair or using more than a hair dryer to curl my hair due to time constraints and having very un-curler-friendly hair. I bought this on the recommendation of a friend whose hair always looks fantastic, and she insisted it was something I could handle myself. While the contraption looks complicated at first, it's actually great for people who are not super experienced with using curling irons. Even for women with thin hair, there's little risk of burning your hair because you can select the right temperature for your particular hair type. The best part: This curler is practically idiot-proof. Say you want big fluffy curls. Not only do you not need to change out a rod to match the thickness of the curl, but you can also select the timer that coordinates with that kind of curl. And even if you leave the curler on your hair too long, it's designed to time itself out after a little bit so you have less of a risk of burning your hair. Some other nice perks: it'll change the rotation of the curler so your curls can point in either direction (relieving the user of the pain of trying to twist their hands backwards to get more natural looking curls). There are multiple features to protect your skin and your countertop from the heat of the curler, and includes an automatic shut-off in case you forget to unplug it when you're done. The handle of the curler itself includes an LCD display so you can see what settings you're working with, which I think is a really nice feature considering all the bells and whistles that are included. Overall I think this is a great product! Definitely made a difference with my tough to curl hair!

It seemed about a bit much for a hair curler, but the reviews made it seem so tempting, so I bought it anyways to see what the fuss was about. I ended up being SO enthralled by this curling iron! I'm not much of a hairdresser, I can never get the curls to stay in my hair long enough. But this tool made it look like I had gone to the salon, and it stayed that way! All of my friends were commenting on how good I looked on our night out! Even my boyfriend commented on how nice my hair looked, saying I should style my hair this way more often. The beep it makes when it finished curling your hair is great because I was tired of guessing when it was done, now I don't have to worry about burning any of my hair! It even shuts off after the timer goes off, so my hair is safe even if I left it in there. It looks complicated, but is easy enough to understand. (I was all &#34;My hair is going into a chamber? What?&#34;) I'm not very good with technology to begin with, but figuring this out turned out to be simple. The buttons and controls are a lot easier than they look. I use it almost every day now, and it's so much more fun using the Miraqueen to get those devil-may-care loose curls I adore while still looking neat and clean. My days of searching are over, and I'm definitely getting rid of those other old curling irons for good!

  576. My daughter and I love this curling iron. But the curls last all day and look so beautiful. I find it's more of a special occasion device, it does take awhile to curl an entire head of hair (I do have quite a lot of hair so maybe that's just me), and I wouldn't go to the trouble of doing this just for work, but this works so much better than traditional curling irons, and I love the reverse feature so you don't have to remember which way you just curled. I pull the trigger and allow my hair to enter the chamber, then release it once the curl is finished.<br /><br />I find that I am able to curl my hair with one hand; it is very quick and automatic. Since I don't need to manually curl my hair around the barrel, it makes my curling time much faster! The screen helps me ensure that the iron is at the right temperature so I don't wait around for too long, guessing if it is the right temperature yet.<br /><br />The curls produced are beautiful, and if creates a variety of different curling options from tight, defined curls, to relaxed, beachy curls. I enjoy the mulch-directional setting that lets me change the direction of my curls. I used to forget to do this with manual curling irons, so my curls wouldn't turn out quite as natural. Now I can switch back and forth for the best possible look.<br /><br />Another feature I enjoy are they rubber protector and heat insulating base that prevent me from fumbling around and burning myself or my bathroom counter. This stops me from having to go back and forth, checking to make sure it is balanced right and won't burn anything or pose a fire hazard. The everyday use of the Miraqueen curling iron is effortless and safe. I will never need to buy another curling iron again!
  582. ****i did intentionally Rate 4 Stars! If you read review, hopefully you understand better. :-)<br />The first couple of times that i used this, my hair got stuck and i had to yank it out of the curler, however it did not always come out and i did have to cut some of my hair. Plus it felt as if it took so much longer to curl my hair than if i were to use a curling iron!!!<br />****if your hair does get caught. Instead of trying to just pull your hair right out of curler... Start pulling your hair out of curler while you hold the trigger down as if your curling your hair, so it is trying to curl your hair while you pull. I promise it'll work!<br /><br />***And once i realized the curler works a million times better if it is always facing the same way (as in... The pink is always on top; i attempted to hold it upside down a couple of times because it was more comfortable depending on the area of my head i was curling. It wouldn't curl well and that's when my hair got caught most of the time.<br />****Also, there is a 'V' shaped opening for where your hair goes in, it also makes a huge difference if that 'V' side is closest to your head (opposed to on the far side of curler/away from your head).<br /><br />Once you you're able to get that down, then your knotted/stuck hair days will be over! :-) And you'll beable to curl your hair sooo much faster!!!!   631. Nothing curls my hair. NOTHING. Well, most things curl it, it just falls out almost immediately. Both my parents had curly hair, and I was gypped. Hasn't mattered whether it was thick, natural and to my waist or its now incarnation of overly bleached pink thin fray, its always handled curls the same way. Many a professional have struggled to get my hair to hold a curl for more than half an hour, and every one has failed. I'm not much of a girly-girl, so I've never been able to justify the time, attention and frustration to use most curling irons with such terrible results, so I figured I'd give this a try along with the best rated hair spray and curl prep gel I could find. Even without any hairspray or curl prep gel, and on greasy filthy hair, it still held a curl for 6+ hours. I was amazed. When we tried it on freshly clean hair, it was like a magic trick. Poof, curly until bed, no hair spray needed.<br /><br />I will say that if this didn't function so well once you got used to its quirks, that I'd probably be giving it three stars for the lack of instructions alone. What you see on this page in their sales ad is just a photo copy of the only paperwork they give you with this sucker, and the only information to be had on their website - a wimpy one sided tri-fold out pamphlet that nowhere actually tells you HOW to use it, simply what the features are, and a few pointers that somehow also do not actually inform you of its quirks. This thing has so little information that it took us a while to figure out that all you had to do was hold the thing wide ways to your head with just the right sized strands of hair laying flat across and it would do the rest. There's nothing anywhere to identify what all the beeps mean, or how to fix it once it messes up. As a matter of fact, I can easily see how you'd end up having to cut your hair out of this thing if you mess it up, but it's easy to get the hang of pretty quickly and start to predict when its going to complain and fix it fast enough to save your hair.<br /><br />I do so love the efficiency of this thing though, and my roommate keeps turning us into curly haired disney princesses, so I can't complain really. She's had so much fun playing with it that I haven't actually had to curl my own hair with it most of the time.it fast enough to save your hair.<br /><br />I do so love the efficiency of this thing though, and my roommate keeps turning us into curly haired disney princesses, so I can't complain really.
